message_1:
A company wants to understand the average salary of their employees in a particular department. The department has 100 employees. Using a Simple Random Sampling technique, the company samples 20 employees and finds their salaries to be:

$45,000, $55,000, $60,000, $40,000, $50,000, $52,000, $47,000, $48,000, $57,000, $53,000, $49,000, $42,000, $51,000, $58,000, $43,000, $46,000, $54,000, $56,000, $44,000, $59,000

What would be the point estimate of the mean salary of all 100 employees in the department?
message_2:
To find the point estimate of the mean salary of all 100 employees in the department, we will first calculate the mean of the sampled salaries.

Mean = (Sum of sampled salaries) / (Number of sampled salaries)

Mean = ($45,000 + $55,000 + $60,000 + $40,000 + $50,000 + $52,000 + $47,000 + $48,000 + $57,000 + $53,000 + $49,000 + $42,000 + $51,000 + $58,000 + $43,000 + $46,000 + $54,000 + $56,000 + $44,000 + $59,000) / 20

Mean = $1,060,000 / 20

Mean = $53,000

The point estimate of the mean salary of all 100 employees in the department is $53,000.
